original: sems can khams na gnas pa'i dbang phyug khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs //
analyzed: sems can khams na gnas pa'i dbang phyug khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs //
translated: You, O Lord, who dwell in the realm of sentient beings, have a vajra mind.

original: dga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pas bdag la bskyab tu gsol //
analyzed: dga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pas bdag la bskyab tu gsol //
translated: I pray you protect me, for I desire the great bliss of the delightful goal.

original: mgon po gal te di ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na //
analyzed: mgon po gal te di ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na //
translated: O Lord, if you wish me to live this day,

original: sems can yab chen gnyen mchog bdag la dgyes par mdzad du gsol //🔽zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: sems can yab chen gnyen mchog bdag la dgyes par mdzad du gsol // zhes smos pa la /
translated: make me joyful, O Father of beings, O supreme friend.

original: 'di ni spyan gyi tshigs su bcad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni spyan gyi tshigs su bcad pa ste /
translated: This is the verse on the eyes.

original: khyod ni mdun du gnas pa bzhin du bltas nas bskul ba ste /
analyzed: khyod ni mdun du gnas pa bzhin du bltas nas bskul ba ste /
translated: You are implored as if you were standing in front of me.

original: rdo rje thugs ni thugs kyi dbang nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thugs ni thugs kyi dbang nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Vajra mind is the attainment of the consecration of mind.

original: khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid thob pa'i phyir gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid thob pa'i phyir gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The lord of the abode is the attainment of the sovereignty of the Dharma of the three realms.

original: sems can gyi khams ni 'byung ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ni 'byung ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realm of sentient beings is the lord of the nature of all elements.

original: dga' ba ni rol ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni rol ba ste /
translated: Joy is play.

original: de la yid 'ong ni dga' ba skyed pas dga' ba yid 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de la yid 'ong ni dga' ba skyed pas dga' ba yid 'ong ngo //
translated: Among them, the pleasing joy is the pleasing joy that generates joy.

original: don chen ni mchog tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: don chen ni mchog tu dga' ba ste /
translated: The great meaning is supreme joy.

original: 'dod pas na don chen 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas na don chen 'dod pa'o //
translated: Since it is desired, it is the desire for the great meaning.

original: de lta bu'i dga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pa ni 'khyud pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pa ni 'khyud pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Such pleasing joy and the desire for the great meaning are by means of embracing and so forth.

original: bdag la bskyab tu gsol ba ni rol bar mdzad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la bskyab tu gsol ba ni rol bar mdzad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: Please protect me means please engage in play.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas yab chen ni sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa dang bde ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas yab chen ni sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa dang bde ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great father is the cause of all sentient beings, because he benefits and brings happiness to all sentient beings.

original: bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed pa ni gson par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed pa ni gson par 'dod pa'o //
translated: I am alive, wishing to live, is the desire to live.

original: mgon po ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni gtso bo'o //
translated: Lord is the chief.

original: bdag la dgyes par mdzad pa ni rol bar mdzad du gsol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la dgyes par mdzad pa ni rol bar mdzad du gsol ba'o //
translated: Please delight in me is to play.

original: m'a ma k'i'i bskul ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i bskul ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The urging of Māmakī should be explained.

original: rdo rje sku khyod @73b bka' yi 'khor lo sems can kun la phan //
analyzed: rdo rje sku khyod @73b bka' yi 'khor lo sems can kun la phan //
translated: O Vajra Body, your wheel of speech benefits all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas don du byang chub mchog grub rab tu phan par gzigs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas don du byang chub mchog grub rab tu phan par gzigs //
translated: You see the supreme enlightenment for the sake of Buddhahood as very beneficial.

original: mgon po gal te di ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na //🔽'dod chags dam tshig chags pas bdag la dgyes par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: mgon po gal te di ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na // 'dod chags dam tshig chags pas bdag la dgyes par mdzad du gsol //
translated: Lord, if today you wish me to live,

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /
translated: please delight in me with the passion of the commitment of passion.

original: mi 'jig pa'i sku yin pas na rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i sku yin pas na rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: The Vajra Body is indestructible.

original: bka'i 'khor lo sems can kun la phan pa ni sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: bka'i 'khor lo sems can kun la phan pa ni sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The wheel of speech benefits all sentient beings is the benefit of all sentient beings,

original: bka'i 'khor lo skor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bka'i 'khor lo skor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it turns the wheel of speech.

original: sangs rgyas don du byang chub mchog grub rab tu phan par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas don du byang chub mchog grub rab tu phan par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: The Buddha is the five aggregates.

original: don ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: don ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The benefit is the conventional truth.

original: byang chub ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The enlightenment is the ultimate truth.

original: de dag gi mchog tu grub pa ni bde ba chen po'i sku'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mchog tu grub pa ni bde ba chen po'i sku'o //
translated: The supreme attainment of those is the great bliss body.

original: rab tu phan par gzigs pa ni sems can rnams la phan par mdzad pa'i dgongs pas gsal bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu phan par gzigs pa ni sems can rnams la phan par mdzad pa'i dgongs pas gsal bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The seeing of the benefit is the manifestation by the intention to benefit sentient beings.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags sbyong ba'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags sbyong ba'i rnam pas so //
translated: The passion is the passion of the purification of passion.🔽 The pledge passion is the passion of the nature of the purification of passion.

original: dam tshig chags ba ni 'dod chags kyi sbyong ba'i rang bzhin gyis bdag dgyes bar mdzad pa ni rol bar mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chags ba ni 'dod chags kyi sbyong ba'i rang bzhin gyis bdag dgyes bar mdzad pa ni rol bar mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: The please yourself is the request to enjoy.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The if and so forth are as before.

original: gos dkar mo'i bskul ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gos dkar mo'i bskul ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The exhortation of Pāṇḍaravāsinī should be explained.

original: khyod ni rdo rje gsung ste kun la phan zhing thugs brtse ba //
analyzed: khyod ni rdo rje gsung ste kun la phan zhing thugs brtse ba //
translated: You are the vajra speech, beneficial to all, compassionate,

original: 'jig rten dag gi dgos pa'i don mdzad pa la rtag tu brtson //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag gi dgos pa'i don mdzad pa la rtag tu brtson //
translated: You are always engaged in the work of the world's needs.

original: mgon po gal te di ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na //
analyzed: mgon po gal te di ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na //
translated: Lord, if you wish me to live today,

original: spyod pa dri med kun du bzang po bdag la dgyes par mdzod //🔽ces smos pa la /
analyzed: spyod pa dri med kun du bzang po bdag la dgyes par mdzod // ces smos pa la /
translated: be pleased with me, Samantabhadra, with pure conduct.

original: khyod ni rdo rje gsung ste ni gsung gi dbang phyug nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod ni rdo rje gsung ste ni gsung gi dbang phyug nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You are Vajra Speech, because you have attained the state of Lord of Speech.

original: kun ni sems can gyi khams la phan pa thugs brtse ba ni thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kun ni sems can gyi khams la phan pa thugs brtse ba ni thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: All is the realm of sentient beings. Compassion is the nature of great compassion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis 'jig rten pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis 'jig rten pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ;
translated: For that very reason, you are always engaged in the work of the world's needs through the four abodes of Brahma.

original: rtag tu brtson pa ni dus thams cad du yang dag par gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu brtson pa ni dus thams cad du yang dag par gzhol ba'o //
translated: Always engaged means fully devoted at all times.

original: bdag la dgyes par mdzod ces pa ni rten par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la dgyes par mdzod ces pa ni rten par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Be pleased with me means be my support.

original: bde ba'i spyod pas kun du ni sems can gyis khams la'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i spyod pas kun du ni sems can gyis khams la'o //
translated: With pure conduct all around means in the realm of sentient beings.

original: bzang po ni dge ba mdzad pas na kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: bzang po ni dge ba mdzad pas na kun du bzang po'o //
translated: Good means doing what is virtuous, therefore Samantabhadra.

original: gzhan ni @74a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni @74a * //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained.

original: sgrol ma'i bskul ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrol ma'i bskul ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The invocation of Tara is to be explained.

original: khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs te dam tshig mchog gi phan don che //
analyzed: khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs te dam tshig mchog gi phan don che //
translated: You are the vajra mind, the supreme commitment, of great benefit.

original: yang dag rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gsung mchog mnyam pa nyid gzigs pa //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gsung mchog mnyam pa nyid gzigs pa //
translated: You are the supreme speech of the perfect Buddha, who sees equality.

original: mgon po gal te de ring bdag nyid gson par mchis bzhed na //
analyzed: mgon po gal te de ring bdag nyid gson par mchis bzhed na //
translated: Protector, if today you wish me to live,

original: yon tan rin chen mang po'i gter gyur bdag la dgyes par mdzod //
analyzed: yon tan rin chen mang po'i gter gyur bdag la dgyes par mdzod //
translated: Be pleased with me, the treasure of many jewels of good qualities.

original: ces bya ba ni khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs te ni don yod grub pa'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs te ni don yod grub pa'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
translated: This is said: You are the vajra mind, from the point of view of Amoghasiddhi.

original: rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba las /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba las /
translated: From the perfect union of the vajra and lotus,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha phyung zhing /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha phyung zhing /
translated: The deities of the mandala are emitted.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams sbyangs ba'i phyir rdo rje'i thugs so //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams sbyangs ba'i phyir rdo rje'i thugs so //
translated: You are the vajra mind because you purify the realm of sentient beings who engage in hatred and so forth.

original: las kyi rigs kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir dam tshig mchog go //
analyzed: las kyi rigs kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir dam tshig mchog go //
translated: You are the supreme commitment because you are the lord of the karma family.

original: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can rnams la 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i thabs kyis thar pa stsol bas na phan don che'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can rnams la 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i thabs kyis thar pa stsol bas na phan don che'o //
translated: He is of great benefit, since he bestows liberation on beings who are given to passion by means of the method of purifying passion.

original: sh'akya'i rigs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchog go //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchog go //
translated: He is the best of the perfectly enlightened buddhas, since he is the chief of the Shakyas.

original: yang na bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don mdzad pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchog go //
analyzed: yang na bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don mdzad pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchog go //
translated: Or else, he is the best of the perfectly enlightened buddhas, since he acts for the welfare of the entire world by means of the gnosis of successful activity.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi dbye ba la dmigs pa dang bral bas kyang sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bsan mnyam nyid gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi dbye ba la dmigs pa dang bral bas kyang sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bsan mnyam nyid gzigs pa'o //
translated: He is the seer of sameness, since he is free from the discrimination of self and other and is compassionate toward all beings.

original: yon tan rin chen mang po'i gter gyur bdag la dgyes par mdzod //
analyzed: yon tan rin chen mang po'i gter gyur bdag la dgyes par mdzod //
translated: You are a treasure of many precious qualities, be gracious to me.

original: ces pa ni rten par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rten par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: This means: be my support.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar pa dang / 'od gsal ba skyed par byed do zhes bdag nyid la bsngags par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar pa dang / 'od gsal ba skyed par byed do zhes bdag nyid la bsngags par byed de /
translated: Because of that, you praise yourself, I generate desire, freedom from desire, and the middle desire, and the clear light.

original: mgon po gal te bdag ni de ring gson par mchis bzhed na /
analyzed: mgon po gal te bdag ni de ring gson par mchis bzhed na /
translated: Lord, if you wish for me to live today,🔽 this is the thought: By the method of desire, hatred, and confusion, give me life and vitality like Vajrasattva, and make me live.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi thabs kyis rdo rje sems dpa' lta bu'i tshe dang / srog sbyin pas gson par mdzod ces dgongs pa ste yan lag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi thabs kyis rdo rje sems dpa' lta bu'i tshe dang / srog sbyin pas gson par mdzod ces dgongs pa ste yan lag bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth limb.

original: de ltar tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo rnams kyis bskul bar gyur pas smon lam gyi rgyun gyi shugs kyis stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor las ldang ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo rnams kyis bskul bar gyur pas smon lam gyi rgyun gyi shugs kyis stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor las ldang ste /
translated: Thus, urged by the goddesses who are the nature of the four immeasurables, you rise from the yoga of emptiness by the force of the stream of aspirational prayers.

original: slar yang drag po dang zheb  @74b dang chags pa chen po nyid nyams dang ldan pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dang ldan ba'i rdo rje sems dpa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas par bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste yan lag lnga pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang drag po dang zheb  @74b dang chags pa chen po nyid nyams dang ldan pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dang ldan ba'i rdo rje sems dpa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas par bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste yan lag lnga pa'o //
translated: Again, with the passion of intense passion, endowed with the experience of the three heroes, one should meditate on oneself as abiding in the center of the wheel of Vajrasattva, the five limbs.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /🔽de ltar yang dag yon tan ni //
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste / de ltar yang dag yon tan ni //
translated: That is to be explained.🔽Thus, having praised the Lord

original: brjod pas mgon po de bskul nas //
analyzed: brjod pas mgon po de bskul nas //
translated: with the expression of true qualities,

original: mi bskyod pa sogs ngo bo yis //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa sogs ngo bo yis //
translated: with the nature of Akshobhya and so forth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bstod par mdzad //🔽ces smos pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bstod par mdzad // ces smos pa la /
translated: the Tathagatas are praised.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis yan lag lnga pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis yan lag lnga pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the first half of the verse teaches the five limbs.

original: yang dag yon tan brjod pas ni yang dag par gyur pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs la bstod pas bskul ba ni lnga pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag yon tan brjod pas ni yang dag par gyur pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs la bstod pas bskul ba ni lnga pa ste /
translated: With the expression of true qualities, having praised the assembly of true qualities, the invocation is the fifth.

original: mgon po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa yin la /
analyzed: mgon po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa yin la /
translated: The Lord is the nature of Akshobhya, the Bhagavat Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Tathagatas are the four beginning with Vairocana.

original: bstod pa mdzad pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshig gi rgyun gyi bstod ba mdzad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bstod pa mdzad pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshig gi rgyun gyi bstod ba mdzad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The one who is praised is Akshobhya, etc. , the praise is the stream of words of the nature of the Tathagatas, and the one who meditates on the praise is the one who is praised.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
translated: This should be explained in detail.

original: mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
analyzed: mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
translated: Akshobhya is the great wisdom vajra,

original: rdo rje dbyings ni nam mkha' che'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings ni nam mkha' che'o //
translated: the vajra realm is the great space,

original: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum //
translated: the three supreme vajras are the three mandalas,

original: gsang ba'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal //🔽zhes smos te ;
analyzed: gsang ba'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal // zhes smos te ;
translated: homage to the secret vajra.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi tshogs kyis mi bskyod pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi tshogs kyis mi bskyod pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Akshobhya is immovable by the accumulation of all afflictions.

original: rdo rje ni thugs gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni thugs gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has that is called a vajra mind.

original: stong ba bzhi'i bdag nyid yin pas na ye shes che'o //
analyzed: stong ba bzhi'i bdag nyid yin pas na ye shes che'o //
translated: He is the great wisdom because he is the nature of the four emptinesses.

original: rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra is Akshobhya, etc.

original: de rnams 'dzin pas na rdo rje dbyings so//
analyzed: de rnams 'dzin pas na rdo rje dbyings so//
translated: He is the vajra realm because he holds those.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi dbye ba la yongs su mkhas pas nam mkha'i chen po'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi dbye ba la yongs su mkhas pas nam mkha'i chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great Space, because he is thoroughly skilled in the division of the two truths.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang sku'i dkyil 'khor dang / phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin yin pas na dkyil 'khor gsum po //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang sku'i dkyil 'khor dang / phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin yin pas na dkyil 'khor gsum po //
translated: He is the Three Circles, because he is the nature of the ultimate circle, the circle of bodies, and the circle of emanations.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i nang na gtso bor gyur pas rdo rje gsum mchog go //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i nang na gtso bor gyur pas rdo rje gsum mchog go //
translated: He is the Best of the Three Vajras, because he is the chief among the Vajras of Body, etc.

original: gsang ba'i rdo rje ni dam tshig gi de kho na nyid kho bo cag la bstan du gsol zhes mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i rdo rje ni dam tshig gi de kho na nyid kho bo cag la bstan du gsol zhes mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: He is the Secret Vajra, because he is the nature of the commitment.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dga' chen po //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dga' chen po //
translated: Vairocana, the Great Joy,

original: rdo rje zhi ba dga' ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba dga' ba che //
translated: Vajra Peace, the Great Joy,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag @75a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag @75a * //
translated: the Supreme Purity, by nature,

original: dkyil 'khor brtag pa ni cha bcu drug / su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brtag pa ni cha bcu drug / su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //

original: de ru ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: de ru ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //

original: / phan yon bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: / phan yon bshad par bya ba ste /

original: rdo rje'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //

original: thob par 'gyur te the tshom med //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur te the tshom med //

original: ces ba la 'di yis ni sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: ces ba la 'di yis ni sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor te /
translated: Here, “this” refers to the vajra yoga explained above.

original: mi phyed pa ni tshim ba'i tshogs so//
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni tshim ba'i tshogs so//
translated: “Unbreakable” refers to the assembly of satisfaction.

original: gzi can ni nyi ma shar ba'i 'od dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzi can ni nyi ma shar ba'i 'od dang 'dra ba'o //

analyzed: skad cig gis ni bdud rtsi myangs pa tsam gyis 'gyur ro //

original: de ni yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yan lag brgyad pa'o //

original: nang gi sbyin sreg bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nang gi sbyin sreg bshad pa ni /

analyzed: de ltar goms pa'i sngags pa yis //

original: sbyang ba dang ni de bzhin sad //
analyzed: sbyang ba dang ni de bzhin sad //

original: snying ga lkog ma dag sbyangs nas //
analyzed: snying ga lkog ma dag sbyangs nas //

original: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba'i rtog pa spong ba'i phyir dang / tshe ring ba dang / nad med pa dang / bde ba thob pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi zas kyi phyir dang / kham gyi zas spang bar bya ba'i phyir bdud rtsi lngas nang gi sbyin sreg brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba'i rtog pa spong ba'i phyir dang / tshe ring ba dang / nad med pa dang / bde ba thob pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi zas kyi phyir dang / kham gyi zas spang bar bya ba'i phyir bdud rtsi lngas nang gi sbyin sreg brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Here, in order to abandon the worldly conceptions of purity and impurity, in order to attain long life, health, and happiness, and likewise in order to have the food of concentration and in order to abandon the food of morsels, one should begin the inner fire sacrifice with the five nectars.

original: de ltar goms pa ni sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin @77a * //🔽la goms pas so //
analyzed: de ltar goms pa ni sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin @77a * // la goms pas so //

analyzed: sbyang ba dang ni sad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste sbar bar yang bya'o //
translated: One should purify and awaken, and one should also inflame.

original: snying ga lkog ma dag ni lag pa yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: snying ga lkog ma dag ni lag pa yang sbyar bar bya ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams tshim par bya'o zhes mdor bstan pa'o //

original: rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad par bya ste /

original: yi ge h'um gis sbyang ba ste //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gis sbyang ba ste //

original: yi ge a'a yis sad par bya //
analyzed: yi ge a'a yis sad par bya //
translated: The awakening is with the syllable a.

original: aom gyis mnan zhing sbar ba ste //
analyzed: aom gyis mnan zhing sbar ba ste //
translated: The pressing and inflaming is with om.

original: 'di ni bza' ba sgrub pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni bza' ba sgrub pa yin //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the food.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: re zhig dang po yi ge yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang ram las me'i dkyil 'khor la ba las padma'i snod du mar bi shu mu'i sa bon dang / go ku da ha na dang bcas pa'i sa bon bkod de /
analyzed: re zhig dang po yi ge yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang ram las me'i dkyil 'khor la ba las padma'i snod du mar bi shu mu'i sa bon dang / go ku da ha na dang bcas pa'i sa bon bkod de /
translated: First, on a wind mandala from the syllable yam and a fire mandala from the syllable ram, in a vessel of a lotus from the syllable va, one should arrange the seed syllables of clarified butter, rice, and barley, together with the seed syllables of cow, goat, and sheep.

original: yi ge bcu yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: yi ge bcu yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: From the complete transformation of the ten syllables,

original: ga pur dang / gla rtsi dang / bzhi mnyam pa dang / rang byung dang / rtsa mchog gi rdzas dang / gdong 'gul ba dang / snying mo'i bu dang / sna can dang / mgyogs pa dang / drang srong gi bu las skyes pa'i be sha ta bsgoms te /
analyzed: ga pur dang / gla rtsi dang / bzhi mnyam pa dang / rang byung dang / rtsa mchog gi rdzas dang / gdong 'gul ba dang / snying mo'i bu dang / sna can dang / mgyogs pa dang / drang srong gi bu las skyes pa'i be sha ta bsgoms te /
translated: camphor, musk, the four equal parts, the self-originated, the substance of the supreme channel, the one with a quivering face, the son of the heart, the one with a nose, the swift one, and the one born from the son of the sage.

original: bcu 'dres shing sgron ma lnga bsams la /
analyzed: bcu 'dres shing sgron ma lnga bsams la /
translated: Having meditated on those ten mixed together, imagine the five lamps.

original: de'i steng du /
analyzed: de'i steng du /
translated: Above that,

original: aom a'a: h'um sv'a h'a zhes sa bon lnga bkod de /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um sv'a h'a zhes sa bon lnga bkod de /
translated: arrange the five seed syllables, oṃ, aḥ, huṃ, svā, and hā.

original: de nyid kyi 'od zer gyis nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs bkug la de nyid du bcug ste /🔽de las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus par bkad par bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'od zer gyis nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs bkug la de nyid du bcug ste / de las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus par bkad par bsams te /
translated: The light rays from that invoke Vairocana, and so on, who reside in the sky, and they enter there.

analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis zhu zhing byang chub kyi sems kyi dpa' rlabs su gyur par bltas te /
translated: From that, imagine that Vairocana, and so on, with three faces and six arms, the nature of the three beings, melt into the bodhicitta wave through the power of their union.

original: de la yi ge h'um sngon po dgod cing de spyad par byas la ngag gi dbang phyug gi sa bon gyis sad pa ni /
analyzed: de la yi ge h'um sngon po dgod cing de spyad par byas la ngag gi dbang phyug gi sa bon gyis sad pa ni /
translated: One should place the blue syllable hūṃ there, and having practiced with that, one should awaken the seed of the lord of speech.

original: g-yas dang g-yon du bskor bas yi ge aom dgod cid 'od zer lnga 'bro bar bsams la /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon du bskor bas yi ge aom dgod cid 'od zer lnga 'bro bar bsams la /
translated: By turning to the right and left, one should place the syllable oṃ and imagine the emission of five-colored light rays.

analyzed: de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs shing bdud rtsi sgrub pa bsgom mo //

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bza' bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bza' bsgrub pa ste /

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i kha zas sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i kha zas sgrub pa'o //
translated: the accomplishment of the food of the five nectars.

original: de nas lkog ma'i phyogs su hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dmar po bsams te /
analyzed: de nas lkog ma'i phyogs su hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dmar po bsams te /

original: de'i lte bar h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa bsams la /
analyzed: de'i lte bar h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa bsams la /

original: de'i rtse mo dbus ma la yi ge aom @77b bkod cing ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar ram las skyes pa'i gru gsum gyi dbus su kha dog dmar po'i me lce gsum spro ba'i sprin sgra bsams te /🔽kha ni me thab dang / lag pa g-yon pa dang g-yas pa ni dgang gzar dang / blugs bzar du bsams pa'i cho ga bzhin du yi ge dgod par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i rtse mo dbus ma la yi ge aom @77b bkod cing ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar ram las skyes pa'i gru gsum gyi dbus su kha dog dmar po'i me lce gsum spro ba'i sprin sgra bsams te / kha ni me thab dang / lag pa g-yon pa dang g-yas pa ni dgang gzar dang / blugs bzar du bsams pa'i cho ga bzhin du yi ge dgod par bsams te /
translated: Place the syllable oṃ on the central peak, and imagine a cloud of the sound of the three tongues of flame of red color in the middle of the triangle arisen from raṃ in the heart of the gnosis being.🔽The mouth is the fire-pit, and the left and right hands are the ladle and the spoon, respectively.

original: bdud rtsi'i snod blangs te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i snod blangs te /

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharmm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharmm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /

original: zhes bya ba 'dis rang bzhin dag par lhag par mos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis rang bzhin dag par lhag par mos te /
translated: By this, imagine the natural purity.

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams la sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi thigs pa srin lag dang mthe bo dag gis phul la ;
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams la sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi thigs pa srin lag dang mthe bo dag gis phul la ;

analyzed: ngag gi padma'i lam nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i me la bsreg par bya'o //

original: de ni nang gi sbyin sreg go //
analyzed: de ni nang gi sbyin sreg go //
translated: That is the inner fire offering.

original: de dus brtsams te de ni rtog pa med //
analyzed: de dus brtsams te de ni rtog pa med //

original: de yi kha dog dbyibs dang mtshan ji bzhin //
analyzed: de yi kha dog dbyibs dang mtshan ji bzhin //

analyzed: ces rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sgrub thabs las gsungs pa'o //

original: de nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa /
translated: That is explained:

analyzed: dang po lkog mar padma bsam //

original: de la yi ge hr'i: las byung //
analyzed: de la yi ge hr'i: las byung //

analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma ni //

analyzed: snying gar zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar gru gsum gyi dbus su'o //

analyzed: bsreg pa ni dgang blugs dbul ba'o //

original: de ni bza' ba dang btung ba'i cho ga'i sgo nas nang gi sbyin sreg nyid spros nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bza' ba dang btung ba'i cho ga'i sgo nas nang gi sbyin sreg nyid spros nas bshad par bya ste /

original: rlung gis me ni sbar ba dang // chu yis yongs su smin par byed //
analyzed: rlung gis me ni sbar ba dang // chu yis yongs su smin par byed //

analyzed: dbang chen gyi ni dkyil 'khor gnas // gang du sreg blugs yang dag gnas //
translated: The abode of the maṇḍala of earth🔽is where the sacrificial food is placed.

original: bza' ba btung ba gang yang rung //
analyzed: bza' ba btung ba gang yang rung //
translated: Whatever food and drink

original: de kun des ni 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: de kun des ni 'dzin par byed //
translated: are all held by that.

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: It is said.

analyzed: 'dir lus po 'di la dkyil 'khor ni bzhi ste /

analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gru bzhi pa gsang ba'i gnas su'o //

analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor tshim pa'i rang bzhin zlum po snying ga na'o //

analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor 'tshed pa'i rang bzhin gru gsum pa lkog ma na'o //
translated: The triangular maṇḍala of fire, which has the nature of cooking, is in the throat.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'bud pa'i rang bzhin gzhu'i dbyibs can te lte ba na'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'bud pa'i rang bzhin gzhu'i dbyibs can te lte ba na'o //
translated: The bow-shaped maṇḍala of wind, which has the nature of blowing, is in the navel.

original: de la bza' ba dang btung ba'i dus su bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sngar bkod pa'i rim gyis bdud rtsi lngar byas la /
analyzed: de la bza' ba dang btung ba'i dus su bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sngar bkod pa'i rim gyis bdud rtsi lngar byas la /
translated: At the time of eating and drinking, one should transform the food and drink into the five nectars in the previously described order.

original: kha'i padmar zhugs te /
analyzed: kha'i padmar zhugs te /
translated: They enter into the lotus of the mouth.

original: gsang ba'i padma la gnas pa'i sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyis 'dzin la /
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma la gnas pa'i sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyis 'dzin la /
translated: The mandala of the earth element, which is located in the secret lotus, holds them.

original: lte ba'i padma la gnas pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis lkog mar gnas pa'i de'i dkyil 'khor 'dud la /
analyzed: lte ba'i padma la gnas pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis lkog mar gnas pa'i de'i dkyil 'khor 'dud la /
translated: The mandala of wind, which is located in the navel lotus, causes the mandala of fire, which is located in the throat, to blaze.

original: snying ga na gnas pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin gyis 'tshed par byas la /
analyzed: snying ga na gnas pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin gyis 'tshed par byas la /
translated: The mandala of water, which is located in the heart, causes it to boil by the nature of the cooperative cause.

original: rtsa rgyus thams cad la kun du spyad pa'i rim gyis khyab cing tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa rgyus thams cad la kun du spyad pa'i rim gyis khyab cing tshim par bya'o //
translated: One should spread it and satisfy the entire body by the process of general enjoyment.

original: de nyid bshad @78b par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad @78b par bya ste /
translated: That is explained.

original: kha yi padmas bza' ba ni //
analyzed: kha yi padmas bza' ba ni //
translated: The food is in the lotus of the mouth.🔽It enters the lotus of the heart.

original: snying ga'i padmar yang dag 'jug / lte ba'i padmar gnas pa ni //
analyzed: snying ga'i padmar yang dag 'jug / lte ba'i padmar gnas pa ni //
translated: The one located in the navel lotus

original: kha sbyar sbyor ba'i byed pa yis //
analyzed: kha sbyar sbyor ba'i byed pa yis //
translated: is the agent of the union of the two.

original: gsang ba'i padma las byung ba'i //🔽mtha' mar thal bar nges bar bstan //
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma las byung ba'i // mtha' mar thal bar nges bar bstan //
translated: The secret lotus is the source of the fire element.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: In the end, it is taught to be the ash.

original: de la kha'i padma ni lkog ma'i me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin des bza' ba la sogs pa bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la kha'i padma ni lkog ma'i me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin des bza' ba la sogs pa bza' bar bya ste /
translated: Therein, the mouth lotus is the nature of the fire mandala of the throat. One should eat the food, etc.

original: de'i tshe 'od dpag tu med pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'od dpag tu med pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: , with that, and at that time one should have the pride of Amitābha.

analyzed: snying ga'i padma ni chu'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa ni de'i tshe mi bskyod pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: The heart lotus is the water mandala. One should enter it, and at that time one should have the pride of Akṣhobhya.

original: lte ba'i padma ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: lte ba'i padma ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The navel lotus is the wind mandala.

original: de la gnas pa na de'i tshe don yod grub pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa na de'i tshe don yod grub pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: One should abide in it, and at that time one should have the pride of Amoghasiddhi.🔽How does one cook the food, etc. , which is located in the different places?

original: tha dad pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i bza' ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'tshed par 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i bza' ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'tshed par 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: kha sbyor byed pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: kha sbyor byed pa'i sbyor ba yis //

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung dang me ni tha dad pa'i phyogs la gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung dang me ni tha dad pa'i phyogs la gnas pa yin na /

original: ngo bo nyid kyi gam na gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi gam na gnas pa bzhin no //

original: de ltar dbang chen dang chu dag la yang shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbang chen dang chu dag la yang shes bar bya'o //

original: kha sbyor byed pa ni me dang rlung dag gis sbar ba dang smin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: kha sbyor byed pa ni me dang rlung dag gis sbar ba dang smin pa'i don du'o //
translated: The union is for the purpose of igniting and ripening by fire and wind.

original: sa dang chu dag las 'dzin pa dang / smin pa la lhan cig byed pa nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dag las 'dzin pa dang / smin pa la lhan cig byed pa nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that earth and water are co-operating factors in holding and ripening.

original: gsang ba ni padma'am bshad sgo'i lam nas 'byung zhing phyi rol du phyung la thal bar nges par bstan pa ni me'i las byas nas thal ba'i rang bzhin gyi bshad ba dang / gci ba gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni padma'am bshad sgo'i lam nas 'byung zhing phyi rol du phyung la thal bar nges par bstan pa ni me'i las byas nas thal ba'i rang bzhin gyi bshad ba dang / gci ba gtang bar bya'o //
translated: The secret is the emission of the semen from the lotus or the path of the vagina, and the emission outside is definitely taught as the ash. After performing the function of fire, the semen should be emitted as ash and urine.

original: de'i tshe rnam par snang mdzad kyi nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par snang mdzad kyi nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should have the pride of Vairocana.

original: nang gi sbyin sreg gi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi sbyin sreg gi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: rga ba ma yin na ba min //
analyzed: rga ba ma yin na ba min //

original: 'chi ba ma yin dug sogs min //
analyzed: 'chi ba ma yin dug sogs min //

original: des ni dus min 'chi ba min //
analyzed: des ni dus min 'chi ba min //

original: 'tshe ba thams cad rnams 'joms ba'o //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad rnams 'joms ba'o //🔽zhes smos te /

analyzed: rgas pa ni rgas pa nyid de skra dang kha sbu dkar pa dang / bags pa kum pa nyid do //

analyzed: dus min 'chi ba ni gzhon pa'i dus su 'chi ba'o //

analyzed: logs re re la khru bcu gnyis yod pa byugs te /

original: me tog dgram zhing dbus kyi cha las byung ba lus phyed mi mngon pa kha dog ser mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgya pa /
analyzed: me tog dgram zhing dbus kyi cha las byung ba lus phyed mi mngon pa kha dog ser mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgya pa /
translated: She is golden in color, with one face and two arms, and is adorned with all the ornaments.🔽She holds a golden vase filled with jewels in her two hands.

original: lag pa gnyis kyis rin po ches bkang ba'i gser gyi bum pa bsnams pa sa'i lha mo bsgoms te /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis rin po ches bkang ba'i gser gyi bum pa bsnams pa sa'i lha mo bsgoms te /
translated: She is the goddess of the earth.

original: thal mo sbyar zhing de la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar zhing de la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should join one's palms and make a request to her.

original: skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: All the protector buddhas🔽in the ritual of the way of conduct,

original: spyod pa'i tshul gyi cho ga dang // sa dang pha rol phyin pa la //
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshul gyi cho ga dang // sa dang pha rol phyin pa la //
translated: and in the stages and perfections,

original: lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //
analyzed: lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //
translated: goddess, you are the witness.

original: khyod ni sems can kun gyi ma ;
analyzed: khyod ni sems can kun gyi ma ;
translated: You are the mother of all sentient beings,

original: / khyod ni khams gsum pa yi gzhi //
analyzed: / khyod ni khams gsum pa yi gzhi //
translated: you are the basis of the three realms,

original: khyod ni mngan sum lha mo ste //
analyzed: khyod ni mngan sum lha mo ste //
translated: you are the goddess of the present,

original: bdag la dgyes par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: bdag la dgyes par mdzad du gsol //
translated: please be pleased with me.

original: che ge mo zhes bdag sngags pa //
analyzed: che ge mo zhes bdag sngags pa //
translated: I, the mantra practitioner named so-and-so,🔽having made you the witness in all ways,

original: thugs kyi rdo rje dkyil 'khor mchog / khyod ni kun du dpang byas nas //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje dkyil 'khor mchog / khyod ni kun du dpang byas nas //
translated: in the supreme mandala of the vajra mind,

original: nang par dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
analyzed: nang par dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
translated: In the morning, the mandala should be drawn.

original: @80a * // zhes zhus te mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la sbos dang dril bu'i sgras /🔽khyod kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
analyzed: @80a * // zhes zhus te mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la sbos dang dril bu'i sgras / khyod kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
translated: Having requested in this way, one should make offerings with the five offerings and request departure with the sound of the bell and the bell,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas gshegs su gsol to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas gshegs su gsol to //
translated: saying, You have accomplished all the purposes of sentient beings, and so on.

original: de nyid du thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: de nyid du thim par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that they dissolve into oneself.

original: zhes sa gzhi gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes sa gzhi gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for taking possession of the ground.

original: de nas de'i dbus su h'um las byung ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas de'i dbus su h'um las byung ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgoms te /
translated: Then, in the center of that, one should meditate on the seal of the source of phenomena arisen from hūṃ.🔽On top of that, from the completely transformed seed syllables ya ra la va, one should meditate on the maṇḍalas of wind and so on in the previously explained order.

original: de'i steng du ya ra la wa'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la de'i steng du hr'i: las byung ba'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dmar po'i lte bar sum las skyes pa'i mchod rten gyi bum
analyzed: de'i steng du ya ra la wa'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la de'i steng du hr'i: las byung ba'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dmar po'i lte bar sum las skyes pa'i mchod rten gyi bum
translated: On top of that, from hṛ, one should meditate on a red eight-petaled lotus. In the center of that, from suṃ, one should meditate on a stupa.

original: pa'i nang du bhr'um las skyes pa rnam par snang mdzad kun du zhal yongs su gyur pa las snga ma bzhin du gzhal yas khang bsgoms te /
analyzed: pa'i nang du bhr'um las skyes pa rnam par snang mdzad kun du zhal yongs su gyur pa las snga ma bzhin du gzhal yas khang bsgoms te /
translated: In its center, from BHRŪM, is Vairocana Samantaprabhāsa, who completely transforms into the celestial mansion as before.

original: de'i dbus su sna tshogs padma dang / nyi ma'i gdan bkod la de'i nad nas cig car du byung ba mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor bltas te /
analyzed: de'i dbus su sna tshogs padma dang / nyi ma'i gdan bkod la de'i nad nas cig car du byung ba mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor bltas te /
translated: In its center, he should visualize a variegated lotus and a sun seat, and on that, all at once, the maṇḍala of Akṣobhya.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing gshegs su gsol la /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing gshegs su gsol la /
translated: He should worship it with the five offerings and request it to depart.

original: ji'i thig le byas nas mchod cing gzhag par bya'o zhes ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: ji'i thig le byas nas mchod cing gzhag par bya'o zhes ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having made the drop of ghee, he should worship and place it. This is the rite of accomplishing the ground of gnosis.

original: de nas ha las byung ba sna tshogs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang ; steng du rdo rje'i bla re dang phyogs kun du rdo rje'i ra ba dang / dra ba dang mda'i dra ba dang / me 'od de rigs drug gi rang bzhin bcing bar bya ba ni bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nas ha las byung ba sna tshogs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang ; steng du rdo rje'i bla re dang phyogs kun du rdo rje'i ra ba dang / dra ba dang mda'i dra ba dang / me 'od de rigs drug gi rang bzhin bcing bar bya ba ni bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i cho ga'o //
translated: Then, from HŪṀ, he should visualize a variegated vajra, which completely transforms into the vajra ground, and above, a vajra canopy, and all around, a vajra fence, a net, a network of arrows, and a ring of fire. Binding the six families is the rite of the protection wheel.

original: zhag gnyis pa la ku sha'i stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: zhag gnyis pa la ku sha'i stan la 'dug ste /
translated: On the second day, one should sit on a seat of kuśa grass.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba mthun pa'i mtshan ma mthong bas bgegs bskrad pa'i don du bzhi chas sbyin sreg byas la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba mthun pa'i mtshan ma mthong bas bgegs bskrad pa'i don du bzhi chas sbyin sreg byas la /
translated: Having seen the signs of the auspicious and inauspicious, one should perform the burnt offering of the four-heap offering in order to drive away the obstructors.

original: las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i chus sa gzhi la bsang gtor bya ste bgegs zhi ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i chus sa gzhi la bsang gtor bya ste bgegs zhi ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having sprinkled the ground with water enchanted with the all-activity mantra, one should perform the rite of pacifying the obstructors.

original: zhag gsum pa la rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor gyis phyogs bcu'i brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams gnod mdzes kyis bkug ste /
analyzed: zhag gsum pa la rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor gyis phyogs bcu'i brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba rnams gnod mdzes kyis bkug ste /
translated: On the third day, having summoned the worldly protectors such as Indra of the ten directions with Sumbha Niḥṣaṇṇava, one should place them in their respective places.

original: rang rang gi gnas su bzhag la rkang pa'i 'og tu dgod pa yi ge h'um las byung ba rdo rje lcags kyu can gyi rnal 'byor pa rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa khro bo'i tshig gis khro bo'i sngags bzlas pa dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs dang /
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su bzhag la rkang pa'i 'og tu dgod pa yi ge h'um las byung ba rdo rje lcags kyu can gyi rnal 'byor pa rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa khro bo'i tshig gis khro bo'i sngags bzlas pa dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs dang /
translated: Having visualized the vajra hook arisen from the syllable hūṃ under one’s feet, the practitioner should hold a vajra and a bell, and recite the mantra of the wrathful one with wrathful words in the direction of the maṇḍala.

original: mtshams @80b su g-yas brkyang ba dang / g-yon brkyang ba dang / rkang pa mnyam pa dang / rkang pa mi mnyam pa la sogs pa rkang pa'i tshul dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / padma bcing ba dang / rdo rje khu tshur dang /
analyzed: mtshams @80b su g-yas brkyang ba dang / g-yon brkyang ba dang / rkang pa mnyam pa dang / rkang pa mi mnyam pa la sogs pa rkang pa'i tshul dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / padma bcing ba dang / rdo rje khu tshur dang /
translated: Sometimes the way of the feet is extended to the right, extended to the left, even feet, uneven feet, and so on; the mudras of the hands are joined palms, bound lotus, vajra fist,

original: mchog sbyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sa gnon la sogs pa'i lag pa'i phyag rgya dang / steng du lta ba dang / 'og tu lta ba dang / g-yon dang / g-yas dang / dal bus lta ba dang /
analyzed: mchog sbyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sa gnon la sogs pa'i lag pa'i phyag rgya dang / steng du lta ba dang / 'og tu lta ba dang / g-yon dang / g-yas dang / dal bus lta ba dang /
translated: giving the gift, meditative equipoise, fearlessness, touching the earth, and so on; the way of looking is up, down, to the left, to the right, and slowly looking; the way of the body is standing, sitting, lying down, and so on.

original: nang du lta ba dang / mi dmigs pa la sogs pa lta ba'i phyag rgya dang / drug ldan dang / khyu mchog dang / sa 'dzin dang / bar ma dang / lha dang / lnga pa dang / bdug pa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi khyad par gyis glu len pas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi kun du bskor nas shar phyogs su kha bltas pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: nang du lta ba dang / mi dmigs pa la sogs pa lta ba'i phyag rgya dang / drug ldan dang / khyu mchog dang / sa 'dzin dang / bar ma dang / lha dang / lnga pa dang / bdug pa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi khyad par gyis glu len pas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi kun du bskor nas shar phyogs su kha bltas pas 'jug ste /
translated: Having circumambulated the entire ground of the maṇḍala, one should enter facing east.

original: bar snang nam mkha'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing gur gum la sogs pas byugs pa'i ras dkar pos dkyil 'khor dgab par bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi la byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bar snang nam mkha'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing gur gum la sogs pas byugs pa'i ras dkar pos dkyil 'khor dgab par bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi la byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having made offerings to the tathāgatas of the space of the sky, the consecration of the ground of the maṇḍala is the covering of the maṇḍala with white cloth anointed with saffron, and so on.

original: zhag bzhi pa la rin po che'am /
analyzed: zhag bzhi pa la rin po che'am /
translated: On the fourth day, one should draw the maṇḍala with jewels or🔽cow dung.

original: 'bru'am / kham pa las byung ba ci nus pas rnam pa lnga'i rdul tshon blangs la sangs rgyas lnga'i sngags kyis bsang gtor bya zhing de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bkug cing de nyid du bcug la /
analyzed: 'bru'am / kham pa las byung ba ci nus pas rnam pa lnga'i rdul tshon blangs la sangs rgyas lnga'i sngags kyis bsang gtor bya zhing de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bkug cing de nyid du bcug la /
translated: One should take the colored powders of the five types of earth, such as clay, or of the five types of grain, such as rice, and sprinkle them with water while reciting the mantras of the five buddhas.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs kyi sgo'i lho phyogs su bzhag la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs kyi sgo'i lho phyogs su bzhag la /
translated: One should place them in the southern direction of the eastern door of the mandala.

original: bu mos bsgril ba'i tshon skud lnga aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta sarba dharm'a zhes bya ba'i sngags gsum gyis bsgril te /
analyzed: bu mos bsgril ba'i tshon skud lnga aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta sarba dharm'a zhes bya ba'i sngags gsum gyis bsgril te /
translated: One should twist the five colored threads spun by a virgin girl with the three mantras, “anya-anyo ’nuga-taḥ sarva-dharmāḥ,”

original: snal ma las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis par snang gi nam mkha' las de bzhin gshegs pa bkug cing bcug la rdo rje'i thig skud rdzogs shing aa kham b'i ra h'um /
analyzed: snal ma las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis par snang gi nam mkha' las de bzhin gshegs pa bkug cing bcug la rdo rje'i thig skud rdzogs shing aa kham b'i ra h'um /
translated: and with the light rays arisen from the threads, one should summon the tathāgatas from the sky of the realm of phenomena and dissolve them into the colored powders.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis kha sbyor gyi nang du byin gyis brlabs la bdag nyid mi bskyod pa dang ; phyag rgya m'a ma k'ir dmigs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis kha sbyor gyi nang du byin gyis brlabs la bdag nyid mi bskyod pa dang ; phyag rgya m'a ma k'ir dmigs la /
translated: One should bless the colored powders with the mantra, “a khaṃ va ra haṃ,” and imagine oneself as Akṣobhya and the consort as Māmakī.

original: de med na slob ma bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'am /
analyzed: de med na slob ma bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'am /
translated: If that is not present, one should imagine the disciple as Amṛtakuṇḍali or

original: rdo rje sems dpar bsams la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar bsams la /
translated: Vajrasattva.

original: slob dpon dang slob ma dag gis nam mkha' la thig btab cing tshangs pa'i thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang slob ma dag gis nam mkha' la thig btab cing tshangs pa'i thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
translated: The master and the disciple should cast a line into the sky and draw two Brahmā lines.

original: de nas me'i mtshams nas brtsams @81a * //
analyzed: de nas me'i mtshams nas brtsams @81a * //
translated: Then, beginning from the southeast

original: te ; g-yas su bskor bas thig gdab po //
analyzed: te ; g-yas su bskor bas thig gdab po //
translated: corner, one should cast a line in a clockwise direction.

original: cha chen po bcu drug thig gdab cing phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor phyed phyed du byas la /
analyzed: cha chen po bcu drug thig gdab cing phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor phyed phyed du byas la /
translated: One should cast lines for sixteen major parts, dividing the outer and inner maṇḍalas in half.

original: nang gi phyed la cha chen po bzhi la cha gsum du byas te /
analyzed: nang gi phyed la cha chen po bzhi la cha gsum du byas te /
translated: In the inner half, one should divide the four major parts into three parts.

original: rdo rje gur ni cha chung bzhi dang / lhag ma cha chen gsum gyi cha chung bcu gnyis kyi re mig dgu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje gur ni cha chung bzhi dang / lhag ma cha chen gsum gyi cha chung bcu gnyis kyi re mig dgu 'byung ngo //
translated: The Vajra Tent has four small parts, and the remaining three major parts have twelve small parts, making nine squares.

original: cha chen po gcig gis mchod pa'i lha mo'i re mig gi thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: cha chen po gcig gis mchod pa'i lha mo'i re mig gi thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should cast a line for the square of the offering goddesses with one major part.

original: cha chung gsum dang cha chung gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i gnas dang / rdo rje ra ba'i thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: cha chung gsum dang cha chung gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i gnas dang / rdo rje ra ba'i thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should cast lines for the location of the bodhisattvas and the vajra fence with three small parts and one small part.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for the second direction.

original: phyi'i cha chen po la brgyad de /
analyzed: phyi'i cha chen po la brgyad de /
translated: The outer large part is eight.

original: de la phyogs gcig gi cha chen po bzhi la cha chung bcu drug yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig gi cha chen po bzhi la cha chung bcu drug yin te /
translated: In that, the four large parts of one direction are sixteen small parts.

original: de la panytsa re kh'a la cha chung gcig dang / 'dod yon la gnyis dang / rin chen pha gu la gcig dang / dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa la gnyis so //
analyzed: de la panytsa re kh'a la cha chung gcig dang / 'dod yon la gnyis dang / rin chen pha gu la gcig dang / dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa la gnyis so //
translated: In that, one small part is for the five lines, two for the sense objects, one for the jeweled cornice, and two for the net and half-net.

original: g-yer kha'i dra ba la gcig dang / rdo rje la gcig dang / rta babs la bzhi dang / padma la gcig dang / 'khor lo la gnyis dang / bcugs  la gcig go //
analyzed: g-yer kha'i dra ba la gcig dang / rdo rje la gcig dang / rta babs la bzhi dang / padma la gcig dang / 'khor lo la gnyis dang / bcugs  la gcig go //
translated: One is for the tinkling-bell net, one for the vajra, four for the archway, one for the lotus, two for the wheel, and one for the rainspout.

original: rdo rje ra ba dang me 'od ni cha chung gsum du thig gdab par bya ste mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba dang me 'od ni cha chung gsum du thig gdab par bya ste mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra fence and the fire-ring are to be marked with three small parts for beauty.

original: 'dir thig skud chad pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa byung na bgegs gtor dang / zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir thig skud chad pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa byung na bgegs gtor dang / zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Here, if a fault such as a break in the chalk line occurs, one should make an oblation to the obstructors and perform a pacifying burnt offering.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes thig gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes thig gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is not so. This is the procedure for laying out the lines.

original: de nas sngar lhag par gnas par byas pa'i rngul tshon bdud rtsi 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i sgrub pa pos lag pa g-yon pas dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te rngul tshon dgye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngar lhag par gnas par byas pa'i rngul tshon bdud rtsi 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i sgrub pa pos lag pa g-yon pas dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te rngul tshon dgye bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the practitioner, having previously made the sweat-colored [lines] firm, should, beginning from the northeast, apply the sweat-colored [lines] with his left hand, reciting Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: sna tshogs padma dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i gdan bris la dbus su rdo rje nag po'i phyag rgya bri'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i gdan bris la dbus su rdo rje nag po'i phyag rgya bri'o //
translated: Having drawn a multicolored lotus, moon, and sun seat, draw in the center the black vajra seal.

original: shar la sogs pa'i re mig la 'khor lo dang / rin po cha dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bri ba dang / me'i mtshams la sogs pa'i re mig la /
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i re mig la 'khor lo dang / rin po cha dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bri ba dang / me'i mtshams la sogs pa'i re mig la /
translated: In the squares beginning with the east, draw a wheel, jewel, lotus, and multicolored vajra, and in the squares beginning with the southeast,

original: mig dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / autpala bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / autpala bri bar bya'o //
translated: draw an eye, vajra, lotus, and utpala.

original: phyi'i me'i mtshams su me long dang / bden bral du bi wang dang / rlung du dung phor dang / dbang ldan la ro'i snod do //
analyzed: phyi'i me'i mtshams su me long dang / bden bral du bi wang dang / rlung du dung phor dang / dbang ldan la ro'i snod do //
translated: In the outer southeast, draw a mirror; in the southwest, a vīṇā; in the northwest, a kapāla; and in the northeast, a skull cup.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snam bu rnams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snam bu rnams la /
translated: On the bodhisattva platforms,

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor lo dang / n'a ga ge sar gyi yal ga dang / rdo rje dang // @81b rin po che dang / padma dang / ral gri dang / yang ral gri dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bri'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor lo dang / n'a ga ge sar gyi yal ga dang / rdo rje dang // @81b rin po che dang / padma dang / ral gri dang / yang ral gri dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bri'o //
translated: One should draw a wheel, a branch of nāgapuṣpa, a vajra, a jewel, a lotus, a sword, another sword, and a crossed vajra, respectively.

original: sgo dang mtshoms rnams su dbyug to dang / dbyig pa dang / padma dang / rdo rje dang / lcags kyu dang / dbyug pa dang / rtse gsum dang / ral gri rnams bri'o //
analyzed: sgo dang mtshoms rnams su dbyug to dang / dbyig pa dang / padma dang / rdo rje dang / lcags kyu dang / dbyug pa dang / rtse gsum dang / ral gri rnams bri'o //
translated: One should draw a mace, a club, a lotus, a vajra, a goad, a staff, a trident, and a sword in the corners and intermediate directions.

original: 'og nas steng du ni rdo rje dang 'khor lo bri'o //
analyzed: 'og nas steng du ni rdo rje dang 'khor lo bri'o //
translated: One should draw a vajra and a wheel below, above.

analyzed: ma tshogs na de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / lha mo bzhi'i bum pa dang las thams cad pa'i bum pa yang bsdu ste /

analyzed: bcu las nyud  bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dri zhim pa'i chus bkang la /

analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i nang du aom h'um las skyes pa /

original: dkyil 'khor gyi g-yas phyogs su bzhag pa'i aargham dang / zhabs bsil gyi snod dag blangs la rdo rje'i phyag rgyas aargham dang zhabs bsil phul zhing /
