translated: one should tie on the protection cord enchanted with Amṛtakuṇḍali around the upper arm.

original: snga ma bzhin du su sha la mngon par bzlas te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du su sha la mngon par bzlas te /
translated: Having enchanted suśa with the mantra as before,

original: gcig ni sngas dang / gcig ni stan du byin la rigs kyi bu seng ge'i tshul du nyal ba dang / ji ltar mthong ba'i rmi lam bdag la smros shig ces bstan par bya ba ni slob ma lcag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gcig ni sngas dang / gcig ni stan du byin la rigs kyi bu seng ge'i tshul du nyal ba dang / ji ltar mthong ba'i rmi lam bdag la smros shig ces bstan par bya ba ni slob ma lcag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: one should give one [to the disciple] as a pillow and one as a seat, and instruct him, “Son of noble family, sleep in the manner of a lion, and tell me your dreams as you have seen them.” This is the rite for the disciple to go to sleep.

original: de nas zhag drug pa'i tho rangs langs te /
analyzed: de nas zhag drug pa'i tho rangs langs te /
translated: Then, at dawn on the sixth day, rise up.

original: sku khrus kyi cho ga'i rim gyis khrus byas la me tog la sogs pa mchod pa'i @83b yo byad bsogs te /
analyzed: sku khrus kyi cho ga'i rim gyis khrus byas la me tog la sogs pa mchod pa'i @83b yo byad bsogs te /
translated: Having performed ablutions with the ritual of bathing, gather the offering articles such as flowers, and so on.

original: rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas /
translated: Endowed with the pride of one's pledged deity,

original: sku khrus brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: sku khrus brtsam par bya ste /
translated: one should begin the ablutions.

original: de'i rim pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa'i me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / dri dang / lha bshos dang / na bza' dpa /🔽rgyan dang / mchod yon dang / bum pa dang ; 'bru lnga ni nas dang / gro dang / 'bras dang / so ba dang / til dang / ma sha dang / 'bras yos dang / yungs kar dang / star ga dang / bil ba dang /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa'i me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / dri dang / lha bshos dang / na bza' dpa / rgyan dang / mchod yon dang / bum pa dang ; 'bru lnga ni nas dang / gro dang / 'bras dang / so ba dang / til dang / ma sha dang / 'bras yos dang / yungs kar dang / star ga dang / bil ba dang /
translated: The stages of that are as follows: Whatever flowers, incense, lamps, scents, food offerings, clothes,🔽ornaments, drinking water, vases, and the five grains—barley, wheat, rice, peas, and sesame—are available, as well as māṣa beans, parched rice, white mustard seed, walnuts, bilva fruit,

original: gla gor zho sha dang / dz'a ti pha la dang / sman lnga ni ha sa de pa dang / kanda ka ri dang / sa la pa rni dang / bri ha ti dang / bha la mu dra dang / rin po che lnga ni /
analyzed: gla gor zho sha dang / dz'a ti pha la dang / sman lnga ni ha sa de pa dang / kanda ka ri dang / sa la pa rni dang / bri ha ti dang / bha la mu dra dang / rin po che lnga ni /
translated: plantain bananas, nutmeg, and the five medicines—hasti, kaṇṭakārī, salaparṇī, bṛhatī, and bala—and the five precious substances,

original: aindra n'i la dang / mar gad dang / padma r'a ga dang / bee d'urya dang / shel lo //
analyzed: aindra n'i la dang / mar gad dang / padma r'a ga dang / bee d'urya dang / shel lo //
translated: butter,🔽honey,🔽curds,🔽milk,🔽sesame flour,🔽mung bean flour,

original: sman thams cad dang / dri zhim pa'i til mar dang / mar dang / sprang rtsi dang / zho dang / 'o ma dang / sran ma'i phye dang / gro'i phye dang / lo ma lnga dang ; dar la sogs pa bsogs shing /
analyzed: sman thams cad dang / dri zhim pa'i til mar dang / mar dang / sprang rtsi dang / zho dang / 'o ma dang / sran ma'i phye dang / gro'i phye dang / lo ma lnga dang ; dar la sogs pa bsogs shing /
translated: the five leaves,🔽silk, and so forth.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bum pa byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bum pa byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: Bless the vases in stages.

original: de'i cho ga ni mdun du ji ltar nus pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi g-yas phyogs su yo byad thams cad bzhag la /
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni mdun du ji ltar nus pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi g-yas phyogs su yo byad thams cad bzhag la /
translated: The procedure is as follows: Place all the articles to the right of the maṇḍala in front, as much as one can afford.

original: sngar lhag par gnas pa'i bum pa bcu 'am /
analyzed: sngar lhag par gnas pa'i bum pa bcu 'am /
translated: Place ten vases for the preliminary consecration,

original: lnga'am gcig srog chags med pa dri zhim pa'i chus yongs su gang ba 'bru la sogs pa'i snying po can bzhag cing /
analyzed: lnga'am gcig srog chags med pa dri zhim pa'i chus yongs su gang ba 'bru la sogs pa'i snying po can bzhag cing /
translated: or five or one, completely filled with fragrant water free of living organisms, with kernels of grain and so forth.

original: argha'i snod ni dri zhim pa'i chu dang / zho dang 'bras yos dang / ku sha dang / sman dang / yungs dkar dang / me tog dang gla gor zhi sha dang / ldan pa g-yon phyogs su bzhag ste /
analyzed: argha'i snod ni dri zhim pa'i chu dang / zho dang 'bras yos dang / ku sha dang / sman dang / yungs dkar dang / me tog dang gla gor zhi sha dang / ldan pa g-yon phyogs su bzhag ste /
translated: The vessel for the argha is placed to the left, filled with fragrant water, curd, parched grain, kuśa grass, medicine, white mustard seed, flowers, camphor, and nutmeg.

original: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i sngags kyis lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas shing de nas las thams cad pa'i snod dri zhim pa'i chus bkang ba g-yas phyogs su bzhag ste /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i sngags kyis lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas shing de nas las thams cad pa'i snod dri zhim pa'i chus bkang ba g-yas phyogs su bzhag ste /
translated: Recite the mantra of one's favorite deity twenty-one times. Then, the vessel for all activities, filled with fragrant water, is placed to the right.

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags de bzhin du bzla'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags de bzhin du bzla'o //
translated: Recite the Amṛtakuṇḍali mantra in the same way.

original: de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa mdor bsdus pa zla ba dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pas bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa mdor bsdus pa zla ba dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pas bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Then, the victory vase is generated in brief by the stages of meditation on the moon, vajra, and so on.

original: pi las skyed pa'i padma'i lte bar aa las skyes pa'i zla bar h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje'i h'um gi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhugs pa yongs @84a * //
analyzed: pi las skyed pa'i padma'i lte bar aa las skyes pa'i zla bar h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje'i h'um gi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhugs pa yongs @84a * //
translated: From pi, a lotus arises. In the center of that, from a, arises a moon. On that, from hūṃ, arises a vajra. Light rays from hūṃ in the vajra invite the tathāgatas. They enter and melt into the form of bodhicitta.

original: su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
translated: From that, one becomes white Bhagavat Great Vajradhara with one face and two hands.

original: rdo rje dang / dril bu bsnams pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dang / dril bu bsnams pa /
translated: He holds a vajra and a bell.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: snying bar zla ba dang / rdo rje dang / h'um dang ldan pa yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: snying bar zla ba dang / rdo rje dang / h'um dang ldan pa yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: He is empowered by the three syllables—oṃ āḥ hūṃ—which are on a moon and a vajra in his heart.

original: mi bskyod pa'i cod pan bsams te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i cod pan bsams te /
translated: He has an Akṣobhya crown ornament.

original: de bzhin du bum pa gzhan la mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa dang / spyan ma dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i bar du bskyed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa gzhan la mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa dang / spyan ma dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i bar du bskyed la /
translated: Similarly, generate Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Tārā, and up to Amṛtakuṇḍali in the other vases.

original: de rnams kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
translated: They all have one face and two hands.

original: rang rang gi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rang rang gi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa /
translated: They hold their own hand implements and have their own colors.

original: sgeg pa dang bcas shing rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: sgeg pa dang bcas shing rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are all adorned with all the ornaments and are very charming.

original: rang gi sa bon dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis padma dang / nyi ma'i steng du bzhugs pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis padma dang / nyi ma'i steng du bzhugs pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
translated: One should visualize oneself as Vajrasattva, with one's seed and sign, seated in vajra-paryanka on a lotus and sun, and Amṛtakuṇḍali on a sun-disk, standing on the left foot,

original: sdigs mdzub dang rdo rje gsor bar byed pa bsams te /
analyzed: sdigs mdzub dang rdo rje gsor bar byed pa bsams te /
translated: with threatening forefinger and brandishing a vajra.

original: rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa lan gsum brjod la rdo rje yi ge gsum dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod cing dril bu yang dril bu'i sngags kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa lan gsum brjod la rdo rje yi ge gsum dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod cing dril bu yang dril bu'i sngags kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the one hundred syllables of the venerable [Vajrasattva] three times, and make offerings with the three vajra syllables and with flowers, etc., and also make offerings to the bell with the bell mantra.

original: sngags ni / aom a'a: h'um /
analyzed: sngags ni / aom a'a: h'um /
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: aom badzra ghante ra ni pra ra ni /
analyzed: aom badzra ghante ra ni pra ra ni /
translated: Oṃ vajra-ghaṇṭe raṇi pra-raṇi

original: sam pra ra ni sarba buddha kshe tra pra tsa li te /
analyzed: sam pra ra ni sarba buddha kshe tra pra tsa li te /
translated: saṃ-pra-raṇi sarva-buddha-kṣetra-pra-calite

original: pradzny'a p'a ra mi t'a n'a da sva bh'a be ta badzra dha rm'a hri da ya ni /
analyzed: pradzny'a p'a ra mi t'a n'a da sva bh'a be ta badzra dha rm'a hri da ya ni /
translated: prajñā-pāramitā-nāda-sva-bhāve tava vajra-dharmatā-hrīdaya-ni

original: sam to sha ni h'um h'um hum phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sam to sha ni h'um h'um hum phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: saṃtoṣani hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: de nas rdo rje lag pa g-yas pas blangs te /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje lag pa g-yas pas blangs te /
translated: Then one should take up the vajra with the right hand,

original: g-yon pas dril bu bzung la /🔽g-yas pas kyang spos khang bzung ste dril bu dkrol zhing /🔽rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa lan cig bzlas te /🔽aom badzra dhri ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom dzin dzi ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom ratna dhri ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom a'a ro li ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom pradzny'a dhri ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom ru ru sphu ru dzva la tishtha siddhi lo tsa ne sarba artha s'a dha ni sv'a h'a /🔽aom a'a:sham ka re sh'nti ka re ghu ta ghu ti ni ghu ta ya gha ta ya ghu ti ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: g-yon pas dril bu bzung la / g-yas pas kyang spos khang bzung ste dril bu dkrol zhing / rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa lan cig bzlas te / aom badzra dhri ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a / aom dzin dzi ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a / aom ratna dhri ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a / aom a'a ro li ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a / aom pradzny'a dhri ka a'a: h'um sv'a h'a / aom ru ru sphu ru dzva la tishtha siddhi lo tsa ne sarba artha s'a dha ni sv'a h'a / aom a'a:sham ka re sh'nti ka re ghu ta ghu ti ni ghu ta ya gha ta ya ghu ti ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Holding the bell with the left hand,🔽and holding the incense pot with the right hand, ring the bell🔽and recite the one hundred syllable mantra of the venerable [master] once.🔽Om vajra-dhṛk āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽Om jina-jñāna āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽Om ratna-dhṛk āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽Om ārolik āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽Om prajñā-dhṛk āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽Om ruru sphuru jvalati sthita siddhi locane sarva-artha-sādhani svāhā.🔽Om āḥ śaṃkare śāntika-kare ghuṭa ghuṭini ghuṭaya ghuṭaya ghuṭini svāhā.🔽

original: aom aa ka te bi ka te ni ka te ka tam ka te ga ro te b'irya sv'a h'a /🔽aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /🔽aom @84b na ma: sa manta k'a ya b'aka tsitta badzr'a n'am /🔽na mo badzra kro dh'a ya /
analyzed: aom aa ka te bi ka te ni ka te ka tam ka te ga ro te b'irya sv'a h'a /🔽aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /🔽aom @84b na ma: sa manta k'a ya b'aka tsitta badzr'a n'am /🔽na mo badzra kro dh'a ya /
translated: Oṃ akate vikate nikate khatamkate garote virye svāhā.🔽Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.🔽Oṃ namo samanta kāya vāk citta vajrāṇām.🔽Namo vajrakrodhāya.🔽

original: ma h'a damshottka ta bhe ra b'a ya aa si mu sa la dha r'a ya pa ri shu p'a sha ha st'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a damshottka ta bhe ra b'a ya aa si mu sa la dha r'a ya pa ri shu p'a sha ha st'a ya /
translated: Mahādaṃṣṭrotkaṭa-bheravāya, asi-musala-dhārāya, pariśuṣka-hasatāya.

original: aom aa mri ta kunda li kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
analyzed: aom aa mri ta kunda li kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
translated: Om amṛta-kuṇḍali kha kha khāhi khāhi.

original: tashthi tashthi / bnadha bandha /🔽ha na ha na /
analyzed: tashthi tashthi / bnadha bandha / ha na ha na /
translated: Tasthita tasthita, bandha bandha,🔽hana hana,

original: da ha da ha /
analyzed: da ha da ha /
translated: daha daha,

original: pa tsa pa tsa /
analyzed: pa tsa pa tsa /
translated: paca pacha,

original: gardza gardza / bisphota ya bi spho ta ya ;🔽sarba bi ghn'am bi n'a ya ka ne ma h'a g'a na pa ti dz'i bi ta anta ka r'a ya sv'a h'a zhes bya ba sngags de rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa la aargha dang me tog la sogs pas
analyzed: gardza gardza / bisphota ya bi spho ta ya ; sarba bi ghn'am bi n'a ya ka ne ma h'a g'a na pa ti dz'i bi ta anta ka r'a ya sv'a h'a zhes bya ba sngags de rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa la aargha dang me tog la sogs pas
translated: garja garja, visphuta visphuta,🔽sarva-vighnān vinayaka-ne mahā-gāṇa-pati jīvita anta-kāraya svāhā.🔽 Having offered argha, flowers, and so forth to Jayavijaya and so forth, in sequence, one should burn incense, ring the bell, and offer lamps, food offerings, and filled vessels, and so forth, as before.

original: mchod cing snga ma bzhin du spos gtul ba dang / dril bu dkrol zhing mar me dang ; lha bshos dang / snod gang ba la sogs pa phul zhing lag pa g-yon pa sgeg pa dang bcas pas dril bu blangs la /
analyzed: mchod cing snga ma bzhin du spos gtul ba dang / dril bu dkrol zhing mar me dang ; lha bshos dang / snod gang ba la sogs pa phul zhing lag pa g-yon pa sgeg pa dang bcas pas dril bu blangs la /
translated: Taking up the bell with the left hand, along with gestures,

original: lag pa g-yas pa ku sha dang bcas pas rdo rje rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya bum pa'i steng du bzhag la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa ku sha dang bcas pas rdo rje rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya bum pa'i steng du bzhag la /
translated: With the right hand holding a kuśa grass, place the three-pronged vajra mudra on top of the vase.

original: rang rang sngags kyi bum pa rnams rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa dang bcas pas lan brgya rtsa brgyad rnam par rgyal ba la yongs su bzlas la /
analyzed: rang rang sngags kyi bum pa rnams rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa dang bcas pas lan brgya rtsa brgyad rnam par rgyal ba la yongs su bzlas la /
translated: Recite the individual mantras of the vases together with the one hundred syllable mantra of the venerable [Vajrasattva] one hundred and eight times for the victorious vase.

original: de bzhin du bum pa gzhan dag kyang lan nyi shu rtsa bdun bzlas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa gzhan dag kyang lan nyi shu rtsa bdun bzlas la /
translated: Similarly, recite [the mantra] twenty-seven times for the other vases.

original: yang me tog la sogs pas mchod cing thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas zhu bar gyur par bsam pa ni bum pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: yang me tog la sogs pas mchod cing thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas zhu bar gyur par bsam pa ni bum pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Again, make offerings with flowers and so forth, and imagine that [the vases] melt through the union of method and wisdom. That is the consecration of the vases.

original: de nas sngar bshad pa'i bris sku la sogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de nas sngar bshad pa'i bris sku la sogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Then, bless the Bhagavān in the painted image and so forth with the three syllables as explained before.

original: sku khrus kyi las brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: sku khrus kyi las brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Begin the ritual of bathing the body.

original: dang por snga ma bzhin du spos gtul la 'bras chan gyi chang bu gnyis dang me snong  dang / mar me rnams snod dam bum pa la bzhag ste /
analyzed: dang por snga ma bzhin du spos gtul la 'bras chan gyi chang bu gnyis dang me snong  dang / mar me rnams snod dam bum pa la bzhag ste /
translated: First, as before, burn incense, and place two balls of boiled rice, a lamp, and a butter lamp on a vessel or vase.

original: mdun du gnas pa'i yungs kar lag pas blangs te /
analyzed: mdun du gnas pa'i yungs kar lag pas blangs te /
translated: Take the white mustard seeds in front with your hand.

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis mngon par bsngags la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis mngon par bsngags la /
translated: Recite the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Om, burn away all my sins with the vajra of fire, svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis me dang / chu la gtor la lag ba gnyis kyis blangs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis me dang / chu la gtor la lag ba gnyis kyis blangs te /
translated: With this mantra, sprinkle the fire and water. Take it with both hands.

original: sku gzugs la sogs pa'i mdun du lan gsum bskor la phyi rol du bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs la sogs pa'i mdun du lan gsum bskor la phyi rol du bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Circumambulate the image, etc. three times in front and sprinkle outside with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: de nas bsang gtor gyi chus khrus kyi rdzas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis lan gsum bsang gtor @85a * //
analyzed: de nas bsang gtor gyi chus khrus kyi rdzas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis lan gsum bsang gtor @85a * //
translated: Then, with the water for sprinkling, sprinkle the bathing substances three times with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: byas te ; me tog la sogs pa yang de bzhin du bsang gtor byas la /
analyzed: byas te ; me tog la sogs pa yang de bzhin du bsang gtor byas la /
translated: Also sprinkle the flowers, etc. in the same way.

original: de nas dril bu'i sgra dang / spos gtul zhing shin tu phyis pa'i me long gi gzugs brnyan la rang gi sngags kyis zhabs bsil lan gsum phul te /
analyzed: de nas dril bu'i sgra dang / spos gtul zhing shin tu phyis pa'i me long gi gzugs brnyan la rang gi sngags kyis zhabs bsil lan gsum phul te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis de ltar byas la /

translated: First, for all the activities, with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali, the king of mantras, and with the verse “As soon as he was born…”🔽the gods bathed him.

original: lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
analyzed: lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //

translated: Then with the mantra “Jiṇajika” and the verse explained above, offer a bath with the eastern vase.

original: t'a re zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams dang / rang rang gi bum pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: t'a re zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams dang / rang rang gi bum pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //

analyzed: yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la me tog gror zhing spos gtul te /

analyzed: rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa dang / aom badzra dhri ka ces bya ba'i sngags lan bdun bzlas la /

original: de nas legs par bdugs pa'i ras blangs te /
analyzed: de nas legs par bdugs pa'i ras blangs te /

analyzed: me long la chus phyis pa'i dri'i thig @85b le lnga byas te /

analyzed: me tog gtor zhing bzhag la /

analyzed: dril bu dang spos blangs te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlab par bsams la mngon du gyur par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas nam mkha' nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs bkug cing tshangs pa'i sgo nas zhugs te /
translated: Then, having invoked the assembly of tathāgatas from space, they enter through the crown.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi thig ler bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi thig ler bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: They should be gathered into the bindu of the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma la mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma la mchod par bya ste /
translated: Then the master should make offerings to the disciples.

original: spyi bor me tog snying gar dri //
analyzed: spyi bor me tog snying gar dri //
translated: Flowers on the crown, scent at the heart,

original: spos dang mar me mdun du ste //
analyzed: spos dang mar me mdun du ste //
translated: incense and lamps in front,

original: lha bshos kyang ni mdun du sbyin //
analyzed: lha bshos kyang ni mdun du sbyin //
translated: and also offer food in front.

original: spos dang dril bus sad par bya //🔽de nas / mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
analyzed: spos dang dril bus sad par bya // de nas / mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
translated: Awaken with incense and a bell.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lngas bstod la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lngas bstod la /
translated: Then, with the five verses beginning with “Akṣobhya, great gnosis,”

original: me tog gi phreng ba spyi bor btags la /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba spyi bor btags la /
translated: put the flower garland on their heads.

original: aom su pra tishtha badzre sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom su pra tishtha badzre sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, be firmly established, vajra, svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis rab tu gnas par byas la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis rab tu gnas par byas la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having consecrated with the mantra “Om Vajra Āḥ,” one should explain the reality of the maṇḍala and the reality of the deities.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid ni mnyam pa nyid ye shes rnam par dag pas gru bzhi pa'o ;
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid ni mnyam pa nyid ye shes rnam par dag pas gru bzhi pa'o ;
translated: Therein, the reality of the maṇḍala is that it is square due to the purity of the gnosis of sameness.

original: / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sgo'o //
analyzed: / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sgo'o //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are the gates.

original: rta babs ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: rta babs ni bsam gtan no //
translated: The arched doorways are the meditative absorptions.

original: rdo rje ra ba ni sngags kyi theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba ni sngags kyi theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'o //
translated: The vajra fence is the turning of the wheel of Dharma of the mantra vehicle.

original: me tog 'od ni de'i 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: me tog 'od ni de'i 'phro ba'o //
translated: The flower light is its radiance.

original: tshon lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshon lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The five colors are the nature of the tathāgatas.

original: 'dod yon ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod yon ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The sense objects are the nature of the five sense pleasures.

original: rin po che'i pha gu ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rin po che'i pha gu ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The jeweled beams are the nature of the five gnoses.

original: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa'i snam bu ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa'i snam bu ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The lattice and half-lattice cloths are the nature of the branches of enlightenment.

original: sa gzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The ground is the essence of the four tathāgatas.

original: sna tshogs padma ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang / zla ba dang nyi @90b ma'i gdan ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang / zla ba dang nyi @90b ma'i gdan ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The variegated lotus is the nature of wisdom, and the seat of moon and sun is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: rdo rje'i gur dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gur dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The vajra fence and the vajra insignia, etc. are the nature of the Tathagata.

original: ba dan ni gsung rab yan lag dgu'i rnam par dag pa dang / g-yer kha'i dra ba ni chos kyi sgra'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ba dan ni gsung rab yan lag dgu'i rnam par dag pa dang / g-yer kha'i dra ba ni chos kyi sgra'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The banner is the purity of the nine branches of scripture, and the tinkling network is the nature of the sound of Dharma.

original: bcu gcig rdo rje ni sa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: bcu gcig rdo rje ni sa bcu gcig go //
translated: The eleven vajras are the eleven stages.

original: 'khor lo ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / ri dags  ni gti mug gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'khor lo ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / ri dags  ni gti mug gi rang bzhin te /
translated: The wheel is the turning of the wheel of Dharma, and the deer is the nature of delusion.

original: gzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of the ground mandala.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the five wisdoms is Akshobhya, etc. , and the purity of the earth, etc. is Locana, etc.

original: phyi'i yul rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: phyi'i yul rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: The purity of the external objects is as follows:

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / skye mched drug dang / rtsa rgyus dang tshigs rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / bdud bzhi bcom pa ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnam par dag pa ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / skye mched drug dang / rtsa rgyus dang tshigs rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / bdud bzhi bcom pa ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnam par dag pa ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The purities of the six collections of consciousness are Acala and so forth.

original: lha'i de kho na nyid de phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid de phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: This is the reality of the deities, the empowerment of irreversibility.

original: de nas bris sku dang mda' la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sa phyogs gsang ba'i dbang thob pa'i phyir slob mas bla ma la gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bris sku dang mda' la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sa phyogs gsang ba'i dbang thob pa'i phyir slob mas bla ma la gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: Then, in a secret place free of paintings, arrows, and so on, the disciple should supplicate the guru in order to obtain the secret empowerment:

original: khams gsum las ni des grol ba'i //
analyzed: khams gsum las ni des grol ba'i //
translated: Through that, one is liberated from the three realms

original: nam mkha' dang ni mnyam gyur nyid //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni mnyam gyur nyid //
translated: and becomes equal to space.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyis mi gos pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyis mi gos pa //
translated: Not defiled by desire,

original: dmigs med khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dmigs med khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to you, the objectless one.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhis gsol ba btab pa gsan nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhis gsol ba btab pa gsan nas /
translated: Having listened to the supplication with these and other verses,

original: dam tshig gsum nyan pa'i don du bla mas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gsum nyan pa'i don du bla mas bstan par bya ste /
translated: The master should teach the three pledges for the sake of listening to the Dharma.

original: spong pa lnga dang rig pa lnga //
analyzed: spong pa lnga dang rig pa lnga //
translated: The five abandonments and the five awarenesses

original: rdo rje zhes su bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes su bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as the vajra.

original: zhes rdo rje'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: zhes rdo rje'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of the vajra.🔽Existence is pure by nature,

original: srid pa ngo bo nyid kyis dag / rang bzhin gyis ni srid bral byas //
analyzed: srid pa ngo bo nyid kyis dag / rang bzhin gyis ni srid bral byas //
translated: and is made free from existence by nature.

original: rang bzhin dag pa'i sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa'i sems dpa' ni //
translated: The being whose nature is pure

original: srid pa dam pa 'grub pa yin //
analyzed: srid pa dam pa 'grub pa yin //
translated: attains the highest existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni dril bu'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dril bu'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of the bell.

original: phyag rgya dam tshig bshad pa ste //
analyzed: phyag rgya dam tshig bshad pa ste //
translated: The pledge of the seal is explained

original: yid kyi sku ni brtan phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi sku ni brtan phyir ro //
translated: in order to stabilize the mental body.

original: gang gi sku kun brtan pas na //🔽phyag rgya'i de nyid mngon par brjod //
analyzed: gang gi sku kun brtan pas na // phyag rgya'i de nyid mngon par brjod //
translated: Since the body is stabilized by that,🔽the reality of the seal is expressed.

original: ces bya ba ni phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of the seal.

original: de nas sdom pa gsum bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sdom pa gsum bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the three vows should be explained.🔽The substance of the marabiśu

original: ma ra bi shu mu'i rdzas ni sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rin gyis bza' @91a * //
analyzed: ma ra bi shu mu'i rdzas ni sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rin gyis bza' @91a * //
translated: is to be eaten with the price of the purification and so on.

original: bar bya'o zhes sgron ma myang ba'o //
analyzed: bar bya'o zhes sgron ma myang ba'o //
translated: This is the drinking of the lamp.

original: go ku da ha na ni kha na ma tho ba med pa bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: go ku da ha na ni kha na ma tho ba med pa bza' bar bya ste /
translated: One should eat the go, ku, and da-hana without fault.

original: lcags kyu myong ba'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu myong ba'o //
translated: One should experience the hook.

original: phyag rgya'i padma la yang tsumba na bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i padma la yang tsumba na bya ste /
translated: One should kiss the lotus of the seal.

original: bha ga la tsumba na smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: bha ga la tsumba na smra bar bya'o //
translated: One should kiss the bhaga.

original: de rnams kyang slob mas ji ltar bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyang slob mas ji ltar bka' stsal pa /
translated: The disciple should listen to the words, “I will do just as you have instructed.”

original: de bzhin bgyi'o zhes tshig gsan nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob mas phul ba'i lo bcu gnyis pa'i phyag rgya rigs lngas khyab pa /
analyzed: de bzhin bgyi'o zhes tshig gsan nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob mas phul ba'i lo bcu gnyis pa'i phyag rgya rigs lngas khyab pa /
translated: The vajra master should enter into union with the disciple’s twelve-year-old seal, who is pervaded by the five clans.

original: dang po snyoms par 'jug pa bya ste /
analyzed: dang po snyoms par 'jug pa bya ste /
translated: First, one should enter into union.

original: bde ba chen po'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nam mkha' nas ngag gi lam nas zhugs te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nam mkha' nas ngag gi lam nas zhugs te /
translated: All tathāgatas enter through the path of the vajra and the path of the voice by the sound of great bliss.

original: rtsa dbus ma nas byang chub kyi sems zhu zhing padma'i dbus su spros la /
analyzed: rtsa dbus ma nas byang chub kyi sems zhu zhing padma'i dbus su spros la /
translated: The bodhicitta melts in the central channel and spreads in the middle of the lotus.

original: lag pas ma reg pa dung phor gyis blangs te slob ma'i khar gzhug go //
analyzed: lag pas ma reg pa dung phor gyis blangs te slob ma'i khar gzhug go //
translated: One should take it with a conch cup without touching it with the hand and place it in the disciple’s mouth.

original: slob mas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus da'i blos longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: slob mas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus da'i blos longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: The disciple should enjoy it with the thought that it is the gathering of all tathāgatas.

original: de nas lhag ma'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje chu dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas lhag ma'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje chu dang sbyar te /
translated: Then, having mixed the remaining bodhicitta with the vajra water,

original: slob ma'i spyi bor sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i spyi bor sbyin par bya'o //
translated: it should be given to the head of the disciple.

original: slob mas kyang ae ma'o bde ba chen po zhes tshig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: slob mas kyang ae ma'o bde ba chen po zhes tshig brjod par bya ste /
translated: The disciple should also utter the words, “Amazing! Great bliss!”

original: ji skad du zla gsang thig le las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du zla gsang thig le las kyang /
translated: As it is said in the Candrapradīpa Tantra:

original: byang chub sems ni rin chen 'bar spros nas //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rin chen 'bar spros nas //
translated: Having ignited the blazing jewel of bodhicitta,

original: rgyal ba ma lus yang dag dag pa'i sku //
analyzed: rgyal ba ma lus yang dag dag pa'i sku //
translated: the pure body of all the victors without exception,

original: dag pa'i rdo rje ye shes las byung chu //
analyzed: dag pa'i rdo rje ye shes las byung chu //
translated: the water arisen from the vajra of purity and gnosis,

original: rin chen char gyis spyi bor dbang bskur gsol //
analyzed: rin chen char gyis spyi bor dbang bskur gsol //
translated: I request the empowerment conferred by the rain of jewels on the head.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur gyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the secret empowerment.

original: de nas rang spyod pa'am /
analyzed: de nas rang spyod pa'am /
translated: Then, either oneself or

original: phyag rgya gzhan rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob ma la sbyin pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab pa byed du gzhug ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya gzhan rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob ma la sbyin pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab pa byed du gzhug ste /
translated: another consort, for the sake of giving to the disciple, should be made to request:

original: khong stong khyod kyi sku la med //
analyzed: khong stong khyod kyi sku la med //
translated: You are without an empty interior,

original: sha dang rus pa khrag kyang med //
analyzed: sha dang rus pa khrag kyang med //
translated: without flesh, bone, or blood.

original: khyod kyis 'jig rten rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'jig rten rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: In order to follow the world,

original: 'jig rten pa yi bya ba bstan //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi bya ba bstan //
translated: The activities of the world are taught.

original: sku la nad min mi gtsang min //
analyzed: sku la nad min mi gtsang min //
translated: There is no illness in the body, no impurity,

original: bkres dang skon pa yod pa yin //🔽nam mkha'i 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa//
analyzed: bkres dang skon pa yod pa yin // nam mkha'i 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa//
translated: There is hunger and thirst.🔽Your body is displayed,

original: khyod kyi sku ni bstan par mdzad //
analyzed: khyod kyi sku ni bstan par mdzad //
translated: Like a rainbow in the sky.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas gsol ba btab pa gsan nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas gsol ba btab pa gsan nas /
translated: Having listened to such supplications,

original: dam tshig dang sdom pa nyan du gzhug ste /
analyzed: dam tshig dang sdom pa nyan du gzhug ste /
translated: One should make them listen to the commitments and vows.🔽Whoever hates the commitments,

original: gang zhig dam tshig la sdang dang // gang zhig dam tshig la smod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dam tshig la sdang dang // gang zhig dam tshig la smod pa //
translated: Whoever disparages the commitments,

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa bsrung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa bsrung ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to protect the teachings of the Buddha,

original: de dag 'bad de @91b gsad par bya //
analyzed: de dag 'bad de @91b gsad par bya //
translated: They should be killed with effort.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the union of mantra and mudra,

original: ser sna can rnams bskyab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ser sna can rnams bskyab pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to protect the stingy,

original: gzhan gyi nor rnams phrogs pa na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor rnams phrogs pa na //
translated: When the wealth of others is stolen,

original: khyod ni sdig pas gos pas gos mi 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod ni sdig pas gos pas gos mi 'gyur /
translated: You are not defiled by sin.

original: 'dod chags dang mtshungs bde ba med //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang mtshungs bde ba med //
translated: There is no bliss equal to desire,

original: de ni rgyal ba rnams phul na //
analyzed: de ni rgyal ba rnams phul na //
translated: When that is offered to the victors,

original: sems can don du gzhan gyis smad //
analyzed: sems can don du gzhan gyis smad //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, others disparage it.

original: brtan pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: brtan pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
translated: Through stability, one will attain spiritual powers.

original: rdo rje'i tshig gis brdzun smra ba /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gis brdzun smra ba /
translated: By the vajra words, you speak lies.

original: don yod grub pa'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: By the samadhi of Amoghasiddhi,

original: tshig ni bden min smras pa na //
analyzed: tshig ni bden min smras pa na //
translated: When you speak words that are not true,

original: khyod ni sdig pas gos mi 'gyur //🔽rin chen 'byung ldan mgon po yi //
analyzed: khyod ni sdig pas gos mi 'gyur // rin chen 'byung ldan mgon po yi //
translated: You will not be defiled by sin.🔽By the samadhi of the protector Ratnasambhava,

original: ting nge 'dzin la yid zhugs pas //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la yid zhugs pas //
translated: Your mind is engaged.

original: phan phyir rtsub mo smra bas na //
analyzed: phan phyir rtsub mo smra bas na //
translated: By speaking harshly for the sake of benefit,

original: khyod ni sdig pas gos mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod ni sdig pas gos mi 'gyur //
translated: You will not be defiled by sin.

original: da ni dam tshig lnga brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dam tshig lnga brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the five pledges are to be stated:

original: de nas chags pas chags spong phyir //
analyzed: de nas chags pas chags spong phyir //
translated: Then, in order to abandon attachment through attachment,

original: dpag med rdo rje bsgom par gyis //
analyzed: dpag med rdo rje bsgom par gyis //
translated: Meditate on the vajra of the immeasurable.

original: gti mug gti mug gis 'joms phyir //
analyzed: gti mug gti mug gis 'joms phyir //
translated: In order to conquer delusion with delusion,

original: rnam par snang mdzad sku la brten //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad sku la brten //
translated: Rely on the body of Vairochana.

original: zhe sdang zhe sdang gis zhi phyir //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhe sdang gis zhi phyir //
translated: In order to pacify anger with anger,

original: mi bskyod yongs su bsam par gyis //
analyzed: mi bskyod yongs su bsam par gyis //
translated: Visualize Akshobhya.

original: nga rgyal nga rgyal gyis 'joms phyir //
analyzed: nga rgyal nga rgyal gyis 'joms phyir //
translated: In order to conquer pride with pride,

original: rin chen gtso bo bsgom par gyis //
analyzed: rin chen gtso bo bsgom par gyis //
translated: Meditate on the chief of jewels.

original: phrag dog phrag dog gis 'joms phyir //
analyzed: phrag dog phrag dog gis 'joms phyir //
translated: In order to conquer jealousy with jealousy,

original: rta mchog rnam par bsgom par gyis //
analyzed: rta mchog rnam par bsgom par gyis //
translated: Meditate on the supreme horse.

original: zhes sdom pa lnga sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sdom pa lnga sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the five vows should be given.

original: des kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: And he should say:

original: ji ltar mgon pos bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: ji ltar mgon pos bka' stsal pa //
translated: “Just as the Lord has said,

original: de lta bu ni bdag gis spyad //
analyzed: de lta bu ni bdag gis spyad //
translated: I will practice in that way.”

original: ces thos nas sngar bshad pa'i phyag rgya de la sbyin no //

analyzed: de nas zhag bdun pa la dkyil 'khor pa rnams gshegs su gsol te /

analyzed: nang par langs nas mchod pa rnam pa lngas dkyil 'khor pa rnams mchod la thal mo sbyar zhing //

original: khyod kyis sems can kun don mdzad //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can kun don mdzad //

original: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //

original: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs su gsol //

original: slar yang gshegs par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slar yang gshegs par mdzad du gsol //

original: bskal ba 'am bskal ba brgya yi bar //
analyzed: bskal ba 'am bskal ba brgya yi bar //

original: gang gis gzugs sku gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs sku gnas gyur pa //

analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //

analyzed: lha rnams thams cad srung bar mdzod //

original: thugs ni shin tu dgyes gyur nas //
analyzed: thugs ni shin tu dgyes gyur nas //

analyzed: rang gi gnas su @94b gshegs par mdzod //

analyzed: bu dang tsha bo slob mar bcas //
translated: With sons, grandsons, and disciples,

analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //

original: slob dpon srung bar mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slob dpon srung bar mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: shes rab ye shes dri ma med //

analyzed: dpe med bsam mi khyab la la 'dud //

analyzed: ces brjod pas yi ge mu: 'i mtha' can gyi yi ge brgya pas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: By saying that, request the departure with the hundred-syllable mantra ending with muḥ.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phur bu dang mnga' rnams phyung la 'o mas bkrus te /

original: rdul tshon chu bo la bskyal zhing /
analyzed: rdul tshon chu bo la bskyal zhing /
translated: and take the colored powders to a river.

analyzed: ba'i lci ba dang chus dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi byugs la me tog bkram nas phyag 'tshal zhing smon lam btab nas langs te /
translated: Having anointed the ground of the maṇḍala with cow dung and water, strewn it with flowers, bowed down, made aspirations, and risen up,

analyzed: ji ltar bde bas gnas par bya ba ni gshegs su gsol ba'i cho ga ste yan lag bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: one should remain in whatever is comfortable. This is the rite of requesting the departure, the eleventh branch.

analyzed: de nas nyi ma nub par gyur na dpen pa'i phyogs su thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas sems lhag par mos te /
translated: Then, when the sun has set, in a secluded place, with the yoga of nondual union, with the mind especially intent,

analyzed: rang gi snying gar kham las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i chang gzungs la yi ge ham bkod cing /

analyzed: de la sems gtad nas mig yor lta bur dmigs nas nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Having focused the mind on that, one should lie down, visualizing it like a reflected image.

analyzed: de'i sngon du mthe bo dang gung mos se gol bcu dang gnod mdzes kyi rgyal bos phyogs bcing ba byas na rmi lam bzang po mthong bar 'gyur ro //

original: gal te rmi lam ngan pa mthong na de'i tshe khro bo'i gtor ma gtang na rmi lam bzang po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam ngan pa mthong na de'i tshe khro bo'i gtor ma gtang na rmi lam bzang po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees a bad dream, then at that time one should offer a wrathful bali, and one will see a good dream.

original: rmi lam bzang po yang bla ma la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: rmi lam bzang po yang bla ma la smra bar bya ste /
translated: One should also tell one's good dream to the guru.

original: de mi bzhugs na bris sku dang gzugs sku'i spyan sngar smra'i /
analyzed: de mi bzhugs na bris sku dang gzugs sku'i spyan sngar smra'i /
translated: If he is not present, one should tell it in front of a painted image or a statue.

original: gzhan su la yang smra bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan su la yang smra bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: One should not tell it to anyone else. This is the twelfth branch.

original: bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba bshad par bya ste /🔽dpal rdor phreng ba mchog gi srub shing gis //
analyzed: bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba bshad par bya ste / dpal rdor phreng ba mchog gi srub shing gis //
translated: The dedication of merit should be explained.🔽By churning the ocean of the profound Guhyasamaja

original: zab mo 'dus pa'i rgya mtsho bsrubs byas nas //
analyzed: zab mo 'dus pa'i rgya mtsho bsrubs byas nas //
translated: With the churning rope of the glorious Vajravali

original: sgrub thabs bdud rtsi rnyad pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: sgrub thabs bdud rtsi rnyad pa gang yin pa //
translated: The nectar of the means of achievement has been obtained.

original: 'jig rten kun des 'chi las 'das par shog / ces smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun des 'chi las 'das par shog / ces smos te /
translated: May the whole world thereby transcend death.

original: dpal rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rgyud de stong phrag bcu gnyis pa'o //🔽de nyid mchog gi srub shing ste //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rgyud de stong phrag bcu gnyis pa'o // de nyid mchog gi srub shing ste //
translated: The glorious Vajravali is the explanatory tantra called the Twelve Thousand.🔽It is the supreme churning rope.

original: srub par byed pa'i shing dam pa des so //
analyzed: srub par byed pa'i shing dam pa des so //
translated: With that excellent churning rope.

original: zab mo ni zab pa ste mtha' drug la sogs pa'i don gtso bor gyur @95a * //
analyzed: zab mo ni zab pa ste mtha' drug la sogs pa'i don gtso bor gyur @95a * //
translated: The profound is the profound, which is the meaning of the six limits and so forth.

original: pa'o ; /'dus pa'i rgya mtsho ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; /'dus pa'i rgya mtsho ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The ocean of the Guhyasamaja is the ocean of the Guhyasamaja.

original: bsrubs byas nas ni rab tu bskyod pa sta /
analyzed: bsrubs byas nas ni rab tu bskyod pa sta /
translated: Having churned it, having stirred it well,

original: rnam par sbyangs nas bdag gi sgrub thabs ni mkhor bsdus pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i thabs yan lag gsum cu rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: rnam par sbyangs nas bdag gi sgrub thabs ni mkhor bsdus pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i thabs yan lag gsum cu rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: I have found the means of accomplishment called The Concise Practice, which is a means of accomplishment with thirty-eight branches.

original: bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba rnyed pa gang yin pa des ni 'jig rten kun te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba rnyed pa gang yin pa des ni 'jig rten kun te /
translated: By that, which is like nectar, may the whole world,

translated: may the entire realm of sentient beings without exception, transcend death, and may they attain the state of Vajradhara, who has transcended birth, aging, and death. This is the dedication.

original: sa ni dang po thob pa yi //
analyzed: sa ni dang po thob pa yi //
translated: Having attained the first ground,

original: dpal ldan klu sgrub nyi ma yis //🔽'dus pa'i mtsho skyes rgyas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dpal ldan klu sgrub nyi ma yis // 'dus pa'i mtsho skyes rgyas pa'i phyir //

original: sgrub thabs 'od zer spros par mdzad //
analyzed: sgrub thabs 'od zer spros par mdzad //
translated: in order to expand the ocean of the Guhyasamaja.

original: 'gro ba la ni snang mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba la ni snang mdzad pa //
translated: And appears to the world.

original: mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba 'di //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba 'di //
translated: This one called “The Concise”

original: yang dag man ngag la brten te //
analyzed: yang dag man ngag la brten te //

analyzed: de ni bdag gis gsal bar byas // rtogs med dbul po'i sdug bsngal 'joms byed pa //

analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi rgya mtsho'i nang nas byung //

original: blo bzangs nor bu mkhan gyis legs byas pa //
analyzed: blo bzangs nor bu mkhan gyis legs byas pa //
translated: It is well made by the jeweler of good intellect

analyzed: skye bo rnams kyi mgul par rgyan du 'gyur //

original: rin chen phreng ba zhes bya ba //

original: skye bo dam pa'i snying 'phrog cing //

analyzed: dge ba chen po bdag gis gang rnyed pa //
translated: Whatever great virtue I have gained🔽That is as white as snow, jasmine, or the moon,

analyzed: 'khor ba ma rungs btson ra rnams spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned the terrible prison of samsara,

original: des ni 'gro bas rdo rje 'chang thob shog / mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub thabs kyi 'grel pa rin chen phreng ba zhes bya ba slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
